verses.text:
Now in the first year of Cyrus king of Persia, that the word
of the \nd LORD\nd* by the mouth of Jeremiah might be fulfilled,
the \nd LORD\nd* stirred up the spirit of Cyrus king of Persia, that he made a
proclamation throughout all his kingdom, and \add put it\add* also in
writing, saying,\f + \fr 1.1  \ft made…: Heb. caused a voice to pass\f*

Thus saith Cyrus king of Persia, The \nd LORD\nd* God of heaven
hath given me all the kingdoms of the earth; and he hath charged
me to build him an house at Jerusalem, which \add is\add* in Judah.

Who \add is there\add* among you of all his people? his God
be with him, and let him go up to Jerusalem, which \add is\add* in
Judah, and build the house of the \nd LORD\nd* God of Israel, (he
\add is\add* the God,) which \add is\add* in Jerusalem.

And whosoever remaineth in any place where he sojourneth, let the
men of his place help him with silver, and with gold, and with goods,
and with beasts, beside the freewill offering for the house of God that
\add is\add* in Jerusalem.\f + \fr 1.4  \ft help…: Heb. lift him
up\f*

Then rose up the chief of the fathers of Judah and Benjamin,
and the priests, and the Levites, with all \add them\add* whose spirit
God had raised, to go up to build the house of the \nd LORD\nd* which
\add is\add* in Jerusalem.

And all they that \add were\add* about them strengthened their
hands with vessels of silver, with gold, with goods, and with beasts,
and with precious things, beside all \add that\add* was willingly
offered.\f + \fr 1.6  \ft strengthened…: that is, helped them\f*

Even those did Cyrus king of Persia bring forth by the hand
of Mithredath the treasurer, and numbered them unto Sheshbazzar,
the prince of Judah.

And this \add is\add* the number of them: thirty chargers of
gold, a thousand chargers of silver, nine and twenty knives,

Thirty basons of gold, silver basons of a second \add sort\add*
four hundred and ten, \add and\add* other vessels a thousand.

All the vessels of gold and of silver \add were\add* five
thousand and four hundred. All \add these\add* did Sheshbazzar bring
up with \add them of\add* the captivity that were brought up from
Babylon unto Jerusalem.\f + \fr 1.11  \ft the captivity: Heb. the
transportation\f*

Now these \add are\add* the children of the province that went
up out of the captivity, of those which had been carried away, whom
Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon had carried away unto Babylon,
and came again unto Jerusalem and Judah, every one unto his city;

Which came with Zerubbabel: Jeshua, Nehemiah, Seraiah, Reelaiah,
Mordecai, Bilshan, Mispar, Bigvai, Rehum, Baanah. The number of the
men of the people of Israel:\f + \fr 2.2  \ft Seraiah: also called,
Azariah\f*\f + \fr 2.2  \ft Reelaiah: or, Raamiah\f*\f + \fr 2.2 
\ft Mispar: or, Mispereth\f*\f + \fr 2.2  \ft Rehum: or, Nehum\f*

The children of Parosh, two thousand an hundred seventy and
two.
The children of Shephatiah, three hundred seventy and two.
The children of Arah, seven hundred seventy and five.

The children of Pahath-moab, of the children of Jeshua \add and\add*
Joab, two thousand eight hundred and twelve.
The children of Elam, a thousand two hundred fifty and four.
The children of Zattu, nine hundred forty and five.
The children of Zaccai, seven hundred and threescore.

The children of Bani, six hundred forty and two.\f + \fr 2.10 
\ft Bani: also called, Binnui\f*
The children of Bebai, six hundred twenty and three.
The children of Azgad, a thousand two hundred twenty and two.
The children of Adonikam, six hundred sixty and six.
The children of Bigvai, two thousand fifty and six.
The children of Adin, four hundred fifty and four.
The children of Ater of Hezekiah, ninety and eight.
The children of Bezai, three hundred twenty and three.

The children of Jorah, an hundred and twelve.\f + \fr 2.18 
\ft Jorah: also called, Hariph\f*
The children of Hashum, two hundred twenty and three.

The children of Gibbar, ninety and five.\f + \fr 2.20  \ft Gibbar: also called,
Gibeon\f*
The children of Beth-lehem, an hundred twenty and three.
The men of Netophah, fifty and six.
The men of Anathoth, an hundred twenty and eight.

The children of Azmaveth, forty and two.\f + \fr 2.24  \ft Azmaveth: also called,
Beth-azmaveth\f*

The children of Kirjath-arim, Chephirah, and Beeroth, seven
hundred and forty and three.
The children of Ramah and Gaba, six hundred twenty and one.
The men of Michmas, an hundred twenty and two.
The men of Beth-el and Ai, two hundred twenty and three.
The children of Nebo, fifty and two.
The children of Magbish, an hundred fifty and six.

The children of the other Elam, a thousand two hundred fifty
and four.
The children of Harim, three hundred and twenty.

The children of Lod, Hadid, and Ono, seven hundred twenty
and five.\f + \fr 2.33  \ft Hadid: or, Harid, as it is in some copies\f*
The children of Jericho, three hundred forty and five.

The children of Senaah, three thousand and six hundred and
thirty.

The priests: the children of Jedaiah, of the house of Jeshua,
nine hundred seventy and three.
The children of Immer, a thousand fifty and two.
The children of Pashur, a thousand two hundred forty and seven.
The children of Harim, a thousand and seventeen.

The Levites: the children of Jeshua and Kadmiel, of the children
of Hodaviah, seventy and four.\f + \fr 2.40  \ft Hodaviah: also called, Judah or
Hodevah\f*

The singers: the children of Asaph, an hundred twenty and
eight.

The children of the porters: the children of Shallum, the
children of Ater, the children of Talmon, the children of Akkub,
the children of Hatita, the children of Shobai, \add in\add* all an
hundred thirty and nine.

The Nethinims: the children of Ziha, the children of Hasupha,
the children of Tabbaoth,

The children of Keros, the children of Siaha, the children
of Padon,\f + \fr 2.44  \ft Siaha: also called, Sia\f*

The children of Lebanah, the children of Hagabah, the children
of Akkub,

The children of Hagab, the children of Shalmai, the children
of Hanan,\f + \fr 2.46  \ft Shalmai: also called, Shamlai\f*

The children of Giddel, the children of Gahar, the children
of Reaiah,

The children of Rezin, the children of Nekoda, the children
of Gazzam,

The children of Uzza, the children of Paseah, the children
of Besai,

The children of Asnah, the children of Mehunim, the children
of Nephusim,\f + \fr 2.50  \ft Nephusim: also called, Nephishesim\f*

The children of Bakbuk, the children of Hakupha, the children
of Harhur,

The children of Bazluth, the children of Mehida, the children
of Harsha,\f + \fr 2.52  \ft Bazluth: also called, Bazlith\f*

The children of Barkos, the children of Sisera, the children
of Thamah,

The children of Solomon’s servants: the children of Sotai,
the children of Sophereth, the children of Peruda,\f + \fr 2.55 
\ft Peruda: also called, Perida\f*

The children of Jaalah, the children of Darkon, the children
of Giddel,

The children of Shephatiah, the children of Hattil, the children
of Pochereth of Zebaim, the children of Ami.\f + \fr 2.57  \ft Ami: also called,
Amon\f*

All the Nethinims, and the children of Solomon’s servants,
\add were\add* three hundred ninety and two.

And these \add were\add* they which went up from Tel-melah,
Tel-harsa, Cherub, Addan, \add and\add* Immer: but they could not
shew their father’s house, and their seed, whether they \add were\add*
of Israel:\f + \fr 2.59  \ft Addan: also called, Addon\f*\f + \fr 2.59 
\ft seed: or, pedigree\f*

The children of Delaiah, the children of Tobiah, the children
of Nekoda, six hundred fifty and two.

And of the children of the priests: the children of Habaiah,
the children of Koz, the children of Barzillai; which took a wife
of the daughters of Barzillai the Gileadite, and was called after their
name:

These sought their register \add among\add* those that were reckoned by
genealogy, but they were not found: therefore were they, as polluted,
put from the priesthood.\f + \fr 2.62  \ft were they…: Heb. they were polluted from the
priesthood\f*

And the Tirshatha said unto them, that they should not eat
of the most holy things, till there stood up a priest with Urim and with
Thummim.\f + \fr 2.63  \ft Tirshatha: or, governor\f*

The whole congregation together \add was\add* forty and two
thousand three hundred \add and\add* threescore,

Beside their servants and their maids, of whom \add there
were\add* seven thousand three hundred thirty and seven: and \add 
there were\add* among them two hundred singing men and singing women.

Their horses \add were\add* seven hundred thirty and six;
their mules, two hundred forty and five;

Their camels, four hundred thirty and five; \add their\add*
asses, six thousand seven hundred and twenty.

And \add some\add* of the chief of the fathers, when they
came to the house of the \nd LORD\nd* which \add is\add* at Jerusalem,
offered freely for the house of God to set it up in his place:

They gave after their ability unto the treasure of the work
threescore and one thousand drams of gold, and five thousand pound
of silver, and one hundred priests’ garments.

So the priests, and the Levites, and \add some\add* of the
people, and the singers, and the porters, and the Nethinims, dwelt
in their cities, and all Israel in their cities.

And when the seventh month was come, and the children of Israel
\add were\add* in the cities, the people gathered themselves together
as one man to Jerusalem.

Then stood up Jeshua the son of Jozadak, and his brethren the
priests, and Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, and his brethren, and
builded the altar of the God of Israel, to offer burnt offerings thereon, as
\add it is\add* written in the law of Moses the man of God.\f + \fr 3.2 
\ft Jeshua: also called, Joshua\f*\f + \fr 3.2  \ft Zerubbabel: Gr.
Zorobabel\f*\f + \fr 3.2  \ft Shealtiel: Gr. Salathiel\f*

And they set the altar upon his bases; for fear \add was\add*
upon them because of the people of those countries: and they offered
burnt offerings thereon unto the \nd LORD\nd*, \add even\add* burnt
offerings morning and evening.

They kept also the feast of tabernacles, as \add it is\add*
written, and \add offered\add* the daily burnt offerings by number,
according to the custom, as the duty of every day required;\f + \fr 3.4 
\ft as the duty…: Heb. the matter of the day in his day\f*

And afterward \add offered\add* the continual burnt offering,
both of the new moons, and of all the set feasts of the \nd LORD\nd*
that were consecrated, and of every one that willingly offered a freewill
offering unto the \nd LORD\nd*.

From the first day of the seventh month began they to offer
burnt offerings unto the \nd LORD\nd*. But the foundation of the
temple of the \nd LORD\nd* was not \add yet\add* laid.\f + \fr 3.6 
\ft the foundation…: Heb. the temple of the \+nd LORD\+nd* was not yet
founded\f*

They gave money also unto the masons, and to the carpenters;
and meat, and drink, and oil, unto them of Zidon, and to them of
Tyre, to bring cedar trees from Lebanon to the sea of Joppa, according to the
grant that they had of Cyrus king of Persia.\f + \fr 3.7  \ft carpenters: or,
workmen\f*

Now in the second year of their coming unto the house of God
at Jerusalem, in the second month, began Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel,
and Jeshua the son of Jozadak, and the remnant of their brethren
the priests and the Levites, and all they that were come out of the
captivity unto Jerusalem; and appointed the Levites, from twenty
years old and upward, to set forward the work of the house of the
\nd LORD\nd*.

Then stood Jeshua \add with\add* his sons and his brethren,
Kadmiel and his sons, the sons of Judah, together, to set forward
the workmen in the house of God: the sons of Henadad, \add with\add*
their sons and their brethren the Levites.\f + \fr 3.9  \ft Judah: also called,
Hodaviah\f*\f + \fr 3.9  \ft together: Heb. as one\f*

And when the builders laid the foundation of the temple of the
\nd LORD\nd*, they set the priests in their apparel with trumpets,
and the Levites the sons of Asaph with cymbals, to praise the \nd LORD\nd*,
after the ordinance of David king of Israel.

And they sang together by course in praising and giving thanks
unto the 
d LORD
d*; because \add he is\add* good, for his mercy
\add endureth\add* for ever toward Israel. And all the people shouted
with a great shout, when they praised the 
d LORD
d*, because the
foundation of the house of the 
d LORD
d* was laid.

But many of the priests and Levites and chief of the fathers,
\add who were\add* ancient men, that had seen the first house, when the
foundation of this house was laid before their eyes, wept with a
loud voice; and many shouted aloud for joy:

So that the people could not discern the noise of the shout
of joy from the noise of the weeping of the people: for the people
shouted with a loud shout, and the noise was heard afar off.

Now when the adversaries of Judah and Benjamin heard that the
children of the captivity builded the temple unto the \nd LORD\nd*
God of Israel;\f + \fr 4.1  \ft the children…: Heb. the sons of the
transportation\f*

Then they came to Zerubbabel, and to the chief of the fathers,
and said unto them, Let us build with you: for we seek your God, as ye
\add do;\add* and we do sacrifice unto him since the days of Esar-haddon
king of Assur, which brought us up hither.

But Zerubbabel, and Jeshua, and the rest of the chief of the
fathers of Israel, said unto them, Ye have nothing to do with us to
build an house unto our God; but we ourselves together will build
unto the \nd LORD\nd* God of Israel, as king Cyrus the king of Persia
hath commanded us.

Then the people of the land weakened the hands of the people
of Judah, and troubled them in building,

And hired counsellors against them, to frustrate their purpose,
all the days of Cyrus king of Persia, even until the reign of Darius
king of Persia.

And in the reign of Ahasuerus, in the beginning of his reign,
wrote they \add unto him\add* an accusation against the inhabitants
of Judah and Jerusalem.\f + \fr 4.6  \ft Ahasuerus: Heb. Ahashverosh\f*

And in the days of Artaxerxes wrote Bishlam, Mithredath, Tabeel,
and the rest of their companions, unto Artaxerxes king of Persia;
and the writing of the letter \add was\add* written in the Syrian
tongue, and interpreted in the Syrian tongue.\f + \fr 4.7  \ft Bishlam: or, in
peace\f*\f + \fr 4.7  \ft companions: Heb. societies\f*

Rehum the chancellor and Shimshai the scribe wrote a letter
against Jerusalem to Artaxerxes the king in this sort:\f + \fr 4.8 
\ft scribe: or, secretary\f*

Then \add wrote\add* Rehum the chancellor, and Shimshai the
scribe, and the rest of their companions; the Dinaites, the Apharsathchites,
the Tarpelites, the Apharsites, the Archevites, the Babylonians,
the Susanchites, the Dehavites, \add and\add* the Elamites,\f + \fr 4.9 
\ft companions: Chaldee, societies\f*

And the rest of the nations whom the great and noble Asnappar
brought over, and set in the cities of Samaria, and the rest \add that
are\add* on this side the river, and at such a time.\f + \fr 4.10 
\ft at such…: Chaldee, Cheeneth\f*

This \add is\add* the copy of the letter that they sent unto
him, \add even\add* unto Artaxerxes the king; Thy servants the men
on this side the river, and at such a time.

Be it known unto the king, that the Jews which came up from
thee to us are come unto Jerusalem, building  the rebellious and the
bad city, and have set up the walls \add thereof\add*, and joined
the foundations.\f + \fr 4.12  \ft set up: or, finished\f*\f + \fr 4.12 
\ft joined: Chaldee, sewed together\f*

Be it known now unto the king, that, if this city be builded,
and the walls set up \add again, then\add* will they not pay toll,
tribute, and custom, and \add so\add* thou shalt endamage the revenue
of the kings.\f + \fr 4.13  \ft pay: Chaldee, give\f*\f + \fr 4.13 
\ft revenue: or, strength\f*

Now because we have maintenance from \add the king’s\add*
palace, and it was not meet for us to see the king’s dishonour, therefore
have we sent and certified the king;\f + \fr 4.14  \ft we have…: Chaldee, we are salted with the salt of the
palace\f*

That search may be made in the book of the records of thy
fathers: so shalt thou find in the book of the records, and know
that this city \add is\add* a rebellious city, and hurtful unto kings
and provinces, and that they have moved sedition within the same
of old time: for which cause was this city destroyed. \f + \fr 4.15 
\ft moved: Chaldee, made\f*\f + \fr 4.15  \ft within…: Chaldee, in the midst
thereof\f*

We certify the king that, if this city be builded \add again\add*,
and the walls thereof set up, by this means thou shalt have no portion
on this side the river.

\add Then\add* sent the king an answer unto Rehum the chancellor, and
\add to\add* Shimshai the scribe, and \add to\add* the rest of their
companions that dwell in Samaria, and \add unto\add* the rest beyond
the river, Peace, and at such a time.\f + \fr 4.17  \ft companions: Chaldee,
societies\f*
The letter which ye sent unto us hath been plainly read before me.

And I commanded, and search hath been made, and it is found
that this city of old time hath made insurrection against kings, and
\add that\add* rebellion and sedition have been made therein.\f + \fr 4.19 
\ft I commanded: Chaldee, by me a decree is set\f*\f + \fr 4.19 
\ft made insurrection: Chaldee, lifted up itself\f*

There have been mighty kings also over Jerusalem, which have
ruled over all \add countries\add* beyond the river; and toll, tribute,
and custom, was paid unto them.

Give ye now commandment to cause these men to cease, and that
this city be not builded, until \add another\add* commandment shall be
given from me.\f + \fr 4.21  \ft Give…: Chaldee, Make a decree\f*

Take heed now that ye fail not to do this: why should damage
grow to the hurt of the kings?

Now when the copy of king Artaxerxes’ letter \add was\add*
read before Rehum, and Shimshai the scribe, and their companions,
they went up in haste to Jerusalem unto the Jews, and made them to
cease by force and power.\f + \fr 4.23  \ft by force…: Chaldee, by arm and
power\f*

Then ceased the work of the house of God which \add is\add*
at Jerusalem. So it ceased unto the second year of the reign of Darius
king of Persia.

Then the prophets, Haggai the prophet, and Zechariah the son
of Iddo, prophesied unto the Jews that \add were\add* in Judah and
Jerusalem in the name of the God of Israel, \add even\add* unto them.

Then rose up Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, and Jeshua the
son of Jozadak, and began to build the house of God which \add is\add*
at Jerusalem: and with them \add were\add* the prophets of God helping them.

At the same time came to them Tatnai, governor on this side
the river, and Shethar-boznai, and their companions, and said thus
unto them, Who hath commanded you to build this house, and to make
up this wall?

Then said we unto them after this manner, What are the names
of the men that make this building?\f + \fr 5.4  \ft make: Chaldee,
build\f*

But the eye of their God was upon the elders of the Jews, that they could
not cause them to cease, till the matter came to Darius: and then
they returned answer by letter concerning this \add matter\add*.

The copy of the letter that Tatnai, governor on this side
the river, and Shethar-boznai, and his companions the Apharsachites, which
\add were\add* on this side the river, sent unto Darius the king:

They sent a letter unto him, wherein was written thus; Unto
Darius the king, all peace.\f + \fr 5.7  \ft wherein: Chaldee, in the midst
whereof\f*

Be it known unto the king, that we went into the province of
Judea, to the house of the great God, which is builded with great
stones, and timber is laid in the walls, and this work goeth fast
on, and prospereth in their hands.\f + \fr 5.8  \ft great…: Chaldee, stones of
rolling\f*

Then asked we those elders, \add and\add* said unto them thus,
Who commanded you to build this house, and to make up these walls?

We asked their names also, to certify thee, that we might
write the names of the men that \add were\add* the chief of them.

And thus they returned us answer, saying, We are the servants
of the God of heaven and earth, and build the house that was builded
these many years ago, which a great king of Israel builded and set
up.

But after that our fathers had provoked the God of heaven
unto wrath, he gave them into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar the king
of Babylon, the Chaldean, who destroyed this house, and carried the
people away into Babylon.

But in the first year of Cyrus the king of Babylon \add the
same\add* king Cyrus made a decree to build this house of God.

And the vessels also of gold and silver of the house of God,
which Nebuchadnezzar took out of the temple that \add was\add* in
Jerusalem, and brought them into the temple of Babylon, those did
Cyrus the king take out of the temple of Babylon, and they were delivered unto
\add one\add*, whose name \add was\add* Sheshbazzar, whom he had
made governor;\f + \fr 5.14  \ft governor: or, deputy\f*

And said unto him, Take these vessels, go, carry them into the
temple that \add is\add* in Jerusalem, and let the house of God be
builded in his place.

Then came the same Sheshbazzar, \add and\add* laid the foundation
of the house of God which \add is\add* in Jerusalem: and since that
time even until now hath it been in building, and \add yet\add* it is
not finished.

Now therefore, if \add it seem\add* good to the king, let there be
search made in the king’s treasure house, which \add is\add* there
at Babylon, whether it be \add so\add*, that a decree was made of
Cyrus the king to build this house of God at Jerusalem, and let the
king send his pleasure to us concerning this matter.

Then Darius the king made a decree, and search was made in the
house of the rolls, where the treasures were laid up in Babylon.\f + \fr 6.1 
\ft rolls: Chaldee, books\f*\f + \fr 6.1  \ft laid up: Chaldee, made to
descend\f*

And there was found at Achmetha, in the palace that \add is\add*
in the province of the Medes, a roll, and therein \add was\add* a
record thus written: \f + \fr 6.2  \ft Achmetha: or, Ecbatana, or, in a
coffer\f*

In the first year of Cyrus the king \add the same\add* Cyrus
the king made a decree \add concerning\add* the house of God at Jerusalem,
Let the house be builded, the place where they offered sacrifices,
and let the foundations thereof be strongly laid; the height thereof
threescore cubits, \add and\add* the breadth thereof threescore cubits;

\add With\add* three rows of great stones, and a row of new
timber: and let the expenses be given out of the king’s house:

And also let the golden and silver vessels of the house of
God, which Nebuchadnezzar took forth out of the temple which \add is\add*
at Jerusalem, and brought unto Babylon, be restored, and brought
again unto the temple which \add is\add* at Jerusalem, \add every
one\add* to his place, and place \add them\add* in the house of God.\f + \fr 6.5 
\ft brought again: Chaldee, go\f*

Now \add therefore\add*, Tatnai, governor beyond the river,
Shethar-boznai, and your companions the Apharsachites, which \add are\add*
beyond the river, be ye far from thence:\f + \fr 6.6  \ft your…: Chaldee, their
societies\f*

Let the work of this house of God alone; let the governor of the
Jews and the elders of the Jews build this house of God in his place.

Moreover I make a decree what ye shall do to the elders of
these Jews for the building of this house of God: that of the king’s
goods, \add even\add* of the tribute beyond the river, forthwith
expenses be given unto these men, that they be not hindered.\f + \fr 6.8 
\ft I make…: Chaldee, by me a decree is made\f*\f + \fr 6.8  \ft hindered: Chaldee, made to
cease\f*

And that which they have need of, both young bullocks, and
rams, and lambs, for the burnt offerings of the God of heaven, wheat,
salt, wine, and oil, according to the appointment of the priests which
\add are\add* at Jerusalem, let it be given them day by day without
fail:

That they may offer sacrifices of sweet savours unto the God
of heaven, and pray for the life of the king, and of his sons.\f + \fr 6.10 
\ft of sweet…: Chaldee, of rest\f*

Also I have made a decree, that whosoever shall alter this
word, let timber be pulled down from his house, and being set up,
let him be hanged thereon; and let his house be made a dunghill for
this.\f + \fr 6.11  \ft let him…: Chaldee, let him be destroyed\f*

And the God that hath caused his name to dwell there destroy
all kings and people, that shall put to their hand to alter \add and\add*
to destroy this house of God which \add is\add* at Jerusalem. I Darius
have made a decree; let it be done with speed.

Then Tatnai, governor on this side the river, Shethar-boznai,
and their companions, according to that which Darius the king had
sent, so they did speedily.

And the elders of the Jews builded, and they prospered through the
prophesying of Haggai the prophet and Zechariah the son of Iddo.
And they builded, and finished \add it\add*, according to the commandment
of the God of Israel, and according to the commandment of Cyrus,
and Darius, and Artaxerxes king of Persia.\f + \fr 6.14  \ft commandment: Chaldee,
decree\f*

And this house was finished on the third day of the month
Adar, which was in the sixth year of the reign of Darius the king.

And the children of Israel, the priests, and the Levites,
and the rest of the children of the captivity, kept the dedication
of this house of God with joy,\f + \fr 6.16  \ft the children of the captivity: Chaldee, the sons of the
transportation\f*

And offered at the dedication of this house of God an hundred
bullocks, two hundred rams, four hundred lambs; and for a sin offering
for all Israel, twelve he goats, according to the number of the tribes
of Israel.

And they set the priests in their divisions, and the Levites
in their courses, for the service of God, which \add is\add* at Jerusalem;
